title: In the Shadows of Disinformation: Fake News and Violations of Human Rights
snippet: This report references Fabio Giglietto's work on fake news and disinformation, specifically his definition of disinformation as deliberately false information with the intent to deceive. It discusses the role of disinformation in violating human rights.
description: This research report references Fabio Giglietto's definition of disinformation in the context of human rights violations, demonstrating the impact of his work in the field.

title: festivaldelgiornalismo.com
description: This URL points to a speaker page for Fabio Giglietto at the Festival del Giornalismo (Journalism Festival), likely indicating his participation as a speaker or panelist on a topic related to journalism and/or his areas of expertise.

title: The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking - Vera.ai
snippet: This article discusses a project by vera.ai, facilitated by Fabio Giglietto and others, focusing on the persistence and resilience of misinformation. The study is based on a dataset of Facebook stories identified as problematic by Meta's fact-checkers. It uses OpenAI's GPT models and Mistral AI's embedding tools to identify thematic clusters in misinformation.
description: The article discusses a vera.ai project about misinformation, facilitated by Fabio Giglietto, using GPT models and Mistral AI. The study is based on a dataset of Facebook stories.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: This article mentions Fabio Giglietto as an associate professor at the University of Urbino who studies how actors respond to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior. His research has focused on COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy.
description: The Media Ecosystems Analysis Group podcast episode discusses disinformation campaigns and mentions Fabio Giglietto as an associate professor at the University of Urbino who studies how actors respond to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior, focusing on COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy.

title: Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil
snippet: Reports on Fabio Giglietto's presentations at conferences in Brazil, including his collaborative research on deceptive operations and analysis of political discourse using large language models. He also moderated a roundtable discussion on data access in the DSA era.
description: This vera.ai article reports on Fabio Giglietto's presentations at conferences in Brazil, focusing on his work on disinformation and the use of large language models in political discourse analysis, as well as his moderation of a roundtable on data access.
